I've reviewed your project structure. Before creating a detailed migration plan, I need to clarify a few key architectural decisions:

1. Should the site remain a single-page application with scroll navigation (current design) or become a multi-page site?
   - a) Keep as single-page with all sections (Home, About, Portfolio, Career, Contact) on one page
   - b) Split into separate routes (/about, /portfolio, /career, /contact)

2. Do you want to statically export the Next.js app for hosting on static platforms (Vercel, Netlify, GitHub Pages)?
   - a) Yes, static export (output: 'export' in next.config.js)
   - b) No, keep it as a dynamic Next.js app

3. Should we migrate to TypeScript or keep JavaScript?
   - a) Keep JavaScript (.jsx files)
   - b) Migrate to TypeScript (.tsx files)

Replace Material UI v4 with shadcn/ui components and Tailwind CSS. Preserve all existing functionality, styling, and user experience. The current single-page application will become the root route (&#96;/&#96;), maintaining scroll-based navigation while enabling future multi-page expansion.\n\n## Key Files to Migrate\n- &#96;src/App.js&#96; → &#96;app/page.jsx&#96; (root page)\n- &#96;src/components/Main.jsx&#96; → &#96;app/page.jsx&#96; (integrated)\n- &#96;src/components/*&#96; → &#96;components/*&#96; (all 30+ components)\n- &#96;src/hooks/*&#96; → &#96;hooks/*&#96; (useFetchData, useResizer)\n- &#96;src/helpers/*&#96; → &#96;helpers/*&#96; (animations, scrolling, etc.)\n- &#96;src/styles/*.scss&#96; → Tailwind CSS classes\n- &#96;public/*&#96; → &#96;public/*&#96; (assets remain)\n\n## Implementation Steps\n\n### 1. Next.js Setup &amp; Configuration\n- Initialize Next.js 14+ with app directory\n- Configure &#96;next.config.js&#96; for static assets and fonts\n- Set up &#96;tailwind.config.js&#96; with custom colors matching Material UI theme (blueGrey[900] primary, deepOrange[500] secondary)\n- Configure &#96;tsconfig.json&#96; or &#96;jsconfig.json&#96; for path aliases\n- Set up &#96;app/layout.jsx&#96; with metadata, fonts (Titillium Web, Play, neuropol_nova_cnd), and global styles\n\n### 2. Global Styles &amp; Theme Migration\n- Convert &#96;src/index.css&#96; and &#96;src/App.scss&#96; to &#96;app/globals.css&#96;\n- Migrate SCSS variables to Tailwind config (colors, spacing, typography)\n- Convert &#96;src/styles/_global.scss&#96; styles to Tailwind utilities\n- Migrate &#96;src/styles/_animations.scss&#96; keyframes to Tailwind &#96;@keyframes&#96; in &#96;globals.css&#96;\n- Convert &#96;src/styles/_hero-banner.scss&#96; to Tailwind classes\n- Preserve custom font loading (neuropol_nova_cnd) in &#96;app/layout.jsx&#96;\n\n### 4. Component Migration Strategy\nReplace Material UI components with shadcn/ui equivalents:\n- &#96;Container&#96; → &#96;div&#96; with &#96;max-w-*&#96; Tailwind classes\n- &#96;Typography&#96; → semantic HTML (&#96;h1&#96;, &#96;h2&#96;, &#96;p&#96;, etc.) with Tailwind typography\n- &#96;AppBar&#96; → &#96;header&#96; with Tailwind sticky/fixed positioning\n- &#96;Toolbar&#96; → &#96;nav&#96; with Flexbox utilities\n- &#96;Button&#96; → shadcn &#96;Button&#96; component\n- &#96;Fab&#96; → shadcn &#96;Button&#96; with &#96;fixed&#96; positioning\n- &#96;SwipeableDrawer&#96; → shadcn &#96;Sheet&#96; component\n- &#96;Dialog&#96; → shadcn &#96;Dialog&#96; component\n- &#96;List/ListItem&#96; → &#96;ul/li&#96; with Tailwind styling\n- &#96;IconButton&#96; → shadcn &#96;Button&#96; variant=\"ghost\"\n- Remove &#96;makeStyles&#96; and &#96;useStyles&#96; hooks, replace with Tailwind classes\n- Convert &#96;ThemeProvider&#96; usage to Tailwind CSS variables\n\n### 5. Core Components Migration\n- **AppBar.jsx**: Convert to use shadcn Sheet for mobile drawer, preserve responsive behavior\n- **DesktopAppBar.jsx**: Convert Material UI AppBar/Toolbar to header with Tailwind\n- **MobileAppBar.jsx**: Replace SwipeableDrawer with shadcn Sheet component\n- **NavBar.jsx**: Convert List/ListItem to semantic nav with Tailwind, preserve scroll behavior\n- **HeroBanner.jsx**: Migrate Typography and Container, preserve animation keyframes\n- **Main.jsx**: Integrate into &#96;app/page.jsx&#96;, replace Container with div\n- **ScrollTop.jsx**: Replace Material UI Zoom with framer-motion or CSS transitions\n- **Portfolio/About/Career/Contact**: Migrate all section components systematically\n\n### 6. Hooks &amp; Helpers Migration\n- **useFetchData.js**: Convert to Next.js compatible (works with both client and server)\n- **useResizer.js**: Keep as-is (client-side hook)\n- **helpers/scrolling.js**: Preserve scroll utility functions\n- **helpers/animations.js**: Convert to Tailwind animation utilities or CSS\n- Update all imports to use Next.js conventions\n\n### 7. Data Fetching\n- Keep JSON files in &#96;public/data/&#96; for now (static data)\n- &#96;useFetchData&#96; hook will work in client components\n- Future: Can migrate to Next.js API routes or server components if needed\n\n### 8. Assets &amp; Public Files\n- Move &#96;public/index.html&#96; metadata to &#96;app/layout.jsx&#96;\n- Keep all &#96;public/images/&#96;, &#96;public/fonts/&#96;, &#96;public/data/&#96; as-is\n- Update font paths if needed for Next.js static serving\n\n### 9. Root Page Structure\nCreate &#96;app/page.jsx&#96;:\n&#96;&#96;&#96;javascript\n// Combines App.js + Main.jsx functionality\n// All sections in single page (SPA behavior)\n// Uses client components where needed (hooks, interactivity)\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### 10. Testing &amp; Validation\n- Verify all sections render correctly\n- Test responsive behavior (mobile/desktop)\n- Verify scroll navigation works\n- Check animations and transitions\n- Validate data fetching from JSON files\n- Test drawer/sheet interactions on mobile\n\n## Technical Considerations\n- Use &#96;'use client'&#96; directive for components using hooks or browser APIs\n- Preserve existing scroll-based anchor navigation (&#96;#about&#96;, &#96;#portfolio&#96;, etc.)\n- Maintain exact color scheme: &#96;blueGrey[900]&#96; background, &#96;deepOrange[500]&#96; accents\n- Keep custom fonts: Titillium Web (primary), Play (headings), neuropol_nova_cnd (logo)\n- Preserve all animations (text change, scroll triggers, etc.)\n- Maintain navbar height (60px) for scroll offset calculations\n\n## File Structure After Migration\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n/\n├── app/\n│   ├── layout.jsx          # Root layout with fonts, metadata\n│   ├── page.jsx            # Main SPA page (Home/About/Portfolio/Career/Contact)\n│   └── globals.css         # Tailwind imports + custom styles\n├── components/             # All React components (30+ files)\n├── hooks/                  # Custom hooks\n├── helpers/                # Utility functions\n├── lib/                    # shadcn/ui components\n│   └── utils.js           # cn() utility\n├── public/                 # Static assets (unchanged)\n├── next.config.js\n├── tailwind.config.js\n└── package.json\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n## Future Extensibility\n- Additional pages can be added as &#96;app/[route]/page.jsx&#96;\n- Current SPA remains at root (&#96;/&#96;)\n- Can gradually migrate sections to separate routes if desired\n- shadcn/ui components ready for new features",

Global Styles &amp; Theme Migration\n- Convert &#96;src/index.css&#96; and &#96;src/App.scss&#96; to &#96;app/globals.css&#96;\n- Migrate SCSS variables to Tailwind config (colors, spacing, typography)\n- Convert &#96;src/styles/_global.scss&#96; styles to Tailwind utilities\n- Migrate &#96;src/styles/_animations.scss&#96; keyframes to Tailwind &#96;@keyframes&#96; in &#96;globals.css&#96;\n- Convert &#96;src/styles/_hero-banner.scss&#96; to Tailwind classes\n- Preserve custom font loading (neuropol_nova_cnd) in &#96;app/layout.tsx&#96;\n\n### 4. Component Migration Strategy\nReplace Material UI components with shadcn/ui equivalents:\n- &#96;Container&#96; → &#96;div&#96; with &#96;max-w-*&#96; Tailwind classes\n- &#96;Typography&#96; → semantic HTML (&#96;h1&#96;, &#96;h2&#96;, &#96;p&#96;, etc.) with Tailwind typography\n- &#96;AppBar&#96; → &#96;header&#96; with Tailwind sticky/fixed positioning\n- &#96;Toolbar&#96; → &#96;nav&#96; with Flexbox utilities\n- &#96;Button&#96; → shadcn &#96;Button&#96; component\n- &#96;Fab&#96; → shadcn &#96;Button&#96; with &#96;fixed&#96; positioning\n- &#96;SwipeableDrawer&#96; → shadcn &#96;Sheet&#96; component\n- &#96;Dialog&#96; → shadcn &#96;Dialog&#96; component\n- &#96;List/ListItem&#96; → &#96;ul/li&#96; with Tailwind styling\n- &#96;IconButton&#96; → shadcn &#96;Button&#96; variant=\"ghost\"\n- Remove &#96;makeStyles&#96; and &#96;useStyles&#96; hooks, replace with Tailwind classes\n- Convert &#96;ThemeProvider&#96; usage to Tailwind CSS variables\n\n### 5. Core Components Migration\n- **AppBar.tsx**: Convert to use shadcn Sheet for mobile drawer, preserve responsive behavior\n- **DesktopAppBar.tsx**: Convert Material UI AppBar/Toolbar to header with Tailwind\n- **MobileAppBar.tsx**: Replace SwipeableDrawer with shadcn Sheet component\n- **NavBar.tsx**: Convert List/ListItem to semantic nav with Tailwind, preserve scroll behavior\n- **HeroBanner.tsx**: Migrate Typography and Container, preserve animation keyframes\n- **Main.tsx**: Integrate into &#96;app/page.tsx&#96;, replace Container with div\n- **ScrollTop.tsx**: Replace Material UI Zoom with framer-motion or CSS transitions\n- **Portfolio/About/Career/Contact**: Migrate all section components systematically\n\n### 6. Hooks &amp; Helpers Migration\n- **useFetchData.ts**: Convert to TypeScript and Next.js compatible (works with both client and server)\n- **useResizer.ts**: Convert to TypeScript, keep as client-side hook\n- **helpers/scrolling.ts**: Convert to TypeScript, preserve scroll utility functions\n- **helpers/animations.ts**: Convert to TypeScript and Tailwind animation utilities or CSS\n- **helpers/number.ts, string.ts, url.ts**: Convert all helpers to TypeScript\n- Update all imports to use Next.js conventions and TypeScript types\n\n### 7. Data Fetching\n- Keep JSON files in &#96;public/data/&#96; for now (static data)\n- &#96;useFetchData&#96; hook will work in client components\n- Future: Can migrate to Next.js API routes or server components if needed\n\n### 8. Assets &amp; Public Files\n- Move &#96;public/index.html&#96; metadata to &#96;app/layout.tsx&#96;\n- Keep all &#96;public/images/&#96;, &#96;public/fonts/&#96;, &#96;public/data/&#96; as-is\n- Update font paths if needed for Next.js static serving\n- Ensure static export handles all public assets correctly\n\n### 9. Root Page Structure\nCreate &#96;app/page.tsx&#96;:\n&#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n// Combines App.js + Main.jsx functionality\n// All sections in single page (SPA behavior)\n// Uses client components where needed (hooks, interactivity)\n// TypeScript with proper type definitions\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### 10. should generate &#96;out/&#96; directory)\n\n## Technical Considerations\n- Use &#96;'use client'&#96; directive for components using hooks or browser APIs\n- Preserve existing scroll-based anchor navigation (&#96;#about&#96;, &#96;#portfolio&#96;, etc.)\n- Maintain exact color scheme: &#96;blueGrey[900]&#96; Migrating hooks to TypeScript:

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **write** • Edit file: /Users/sagarsawuck/.cursor/worktrees/sagarsys.net-1/USvKJ/hooks/useFetchData.ts</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 50, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,50 @@
- 
+ import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'
+ 
+ interface UseFetchDataReturn&lt;T&gt; {
+   data: T | null
+   error: Error | null
+   isLoading: boolean
+ }
+ 
+ export default function useFetchData&lt;T = unknown&gt;(
+   apiUrl: string,
+   dataType: string
+ ): UseFetchDataReturn&lt;T&gt; {
+   const [data, setData] = useState&lt;T | null&gt;(null)
+   const [error, setError] = useState&lt;Error | null&gt;(null)
+   const [isLoading, setIsLoading] = useState(true)
+ 
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     async function fetchData() {
+       setError(null)
+       setData(null)
+       setIsLoading(true)
+       try {
+         const response = await fetch(apiUrl)
+         const jsonData = await response.json()
+         return jsonData as T
+       } catch (e) {
+         const error = e instanceof Error ? e : new Error(String(e))
+         console.error(&#96;Fetch ${dataType} failed: \n${error}&#96;)
+         setError(error)
+         setData(null)
+         throw error
+       }
+     }
+     fetchData()
+       .then(setData)
+       .then(() =&gt; setIsLoading(false))
+       .catch((e) =&gt; {
+         const error = e instanceof Error ? e : new Error(String(e))
+         setError(error)
+         setIsLoading(false)
+       })
+   }, [apiUrl, dataType])
+ 
+   return {
+     data,
+     error,
+     isLoading,
+   }
+ }
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,25 @@
- 
+ import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'
+ 
+ export default function useResizer(): boolean {
+   const mobileBreakpoint = 640
+   const [isMobile, setIsMobile] = useState&lt;boolean&gt;(() =&gt; {
+     if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
+       return window.innerWidth &lt; mobileBreakpoint
+     }
+     return false
+   })
+ 
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     function handleSizeChange() {
+       setIsMobile(window.innerWidth &lt; mobileBreakpoint)
+     }
+ 
+     window.addEventListener('resize', handleSizeChange)
+     return () =&gt; {
+       window.removeEventListener('resize', handleSizeChange)
+     }
+   }, [])
+ 
+   return isMobile
+ }
+ 
```

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **write** • Edit file: /Users/sagarsawuck/.cursor/worktrees/sagarsys.net-1/USvKJ/helpers/animations.ts</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 44, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,44 @@
- 
+ interface KeyFrameAnimation {
+   [key: string]: {
+     transform: string
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ export function generateTextLineChangeKeyFrameAnimation(
+   numLines: number
+ ): KeyFrameAnimation {
+   // Number of animations loops = (Number of lines * 2) - 2
+   // Example, there are 4 lines =&gt; 6 is the number of animation.
+   // 1 to 2 --&gt; 2 to 3 --&gt; 3 to 4 --&gt; 4 to 3 --&gt; 3 to 2 --&gt; 2 to 1
+   // 6x + 6y = 100 (100% duration)
+   // y = 4 -&gt; Animation between two lines == Number of lines
+   // x = 12.66 -&gt; Time spent on a line
+   // =&gt; x = (100 / Number of animations) - Number of lines
+ 
+   const numAnimations = numLines * 2 - 2
+   const x = 100 / numAnimations - numLines
+   const y = numLines
+   const animation: KeyFrameAnimation = {}
+ 
+   let i = 0
+   while (i &lt; numAnimations) {
+     if (i === 0) {
+       animation[&#96;0%, ${x.toFixed(2)}%, 100%&#96;] = {
+         transform: 'translate3d(0, 0, 0)',
+       }
+     } else {
+       const deltaY =
+         i &lt; numLines
+           ? (100 / numLines) * -i
+           : (100 / numLines) * -(numAnimations - i)
+       animation[
+         &#96;${((x + y) * i).toFixed(2)}%, ${((x + y) * i + x).toFixed(2)}%&#96;
+       ] = {
+         transform: &#96;translate3d(0, ${deltaY}%, 0)&#96;,
+       }
+     }
+     i++
+   }
+   return animation
+ }
+
```

```diff
- 
+ export function removeHash(): void {
+   let scrollV: number, scrollH: number
+   const { location } = window
+   const { history } = window
+   if ('pushState' in history)
+     history.pushState(
+       '',
+       document.title,
+       location.pathname + location.search
+     )
+   else {
+     // Fallback
+     // Prevent scrolling by storing the page's current scroll offset
+     scrollV = document.body.scrollTop
+     scrollH = document.body.scrollLeft
+ 
+     location.hash = ''
+ 
+     // Restore the scroll offset, should be flicker free
+     document.body.scrollTop = scrollV
+     document.body.scrollLeft = scrollH
+   }
+ }
+ 
```

```diff
- 
+ export function truncateMultiLineString(
+   inputStr: string,
+   numLines: number,
+   charsPerLine: number
+ ): string {
+   const maxStrLength = numLines * charsPerLine
+   return inputStr.length &gt; maxStrLength
+     ? &#96;${inputStr.substring(0, maxStrLength - 3)}...&#96;
+     : inputStr
+ }
+ 
+ export function arrayToString(
+   arr: string[],
+   separator: string = ', '
+ ): string[] {
+   const length = arr.length
+   return arr.map((item, i) =&gt;
+     i !== length - 1 ? &#96;${item}${separator}&#96; : &#96;${item}&#96;
+   )
+ }
+ 
```

```diff
+ 'use client'
+ 
+ import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'
+ import { motion, AnimatePresence } from 'framer-motion'
+ import { handleScrollToTop } from '@/helpers/scrolling'
+ import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'
+ import { ChevronUp } from 'lucide-react'
+ 
+ interface ScrollTopProps {
+   children?: React.ReactNode
+ }
+ 
+ export default function ScrollTop({ children }: ScrollTopProps) {
+   const [isVisible, setIsVisible] = useState(false)
+ 
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     const toggleVisibility = () =&gt; {
+       if (window.scrollY &gt; 100) {
+         setIsVisible(true)
+       } else {
+         setIsVisible(false)
+       }
+     }
+ 
+     window.addEventListener('scroll', toggleVisibility)
+     return () =&gt; window.removeEventListener('scroll', toggleVisibility)
+   }, [])
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;AnimatePresence&gt;
+       {isVisible &amp;&amp; (
+         &lt;motion.div
+           initial={{ opacity: 0, scale: 0 }}
+           animate={{ opacity: 1, scale: 1 }}
+           exit={{ opacity: 0, scale: 0 }}
+           transition={{ duration: 0.2 }}
+           className="fixed bottom-8 right-8 z-50"
+         &gt;
+           {children || (
+             &lt;Button
+               onClick={handleScrollToTop}
+               size="sm"
+               className="rounded-full h-10 w-10 p-0"
+               aria-label="scroll back to top"
+             &gt;
+               &lt;ChevronUp className="h-4 w-4" /&gt;
+             &lt;/Button&gt;
+           )}
+         &lt;/motion.div&gt;
+       )}
+     &lt;/AnimatePresence&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
```

```diff
+ 'use client'
+ 
+ import useResizer from '@/hooks/useResizer'
+ import { cn } from '@/lib/utils'
+ 
+ interface NavBarProps {
+   onClick?: () =&gt; void
+ }
+ 
+ export default function NavBar({ onClick }: NavBarProps) {
+   const navItems = ['about', 'portfolio', 'career', 'contact']
+   const isMobile = useResizer()
+   const navBarHeight = 60
+ 
+   const handleClick = (event: React.MouseEvent&lt;HTMLAnchorElement&gt;, navItem: string) =&gt; {
+     event.preventDefault()
+     const anchor = document.getElementById(navItem)
+     if (anchor) {
+       const scrollY = isMobile
+         ? anchor.offsetTop
+         : anchor.offsetTop - navBarHeight
+       window.scrollTo(0, scrollY)
+       onClick?.()
+     }
+   }
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;nav
+       className={cn(
+         isMobile ? 'block w-[250px]' : 'flex',
+         'list-none m-0 p-0'
+       )}
+       aria-label="main site navigation"
+     &gt;
+       {navItems.map((navItem) =&gt; (
+         &lt;a
+           key={navItem}
+           href={&#96;#${navItem}&#96;}
+           onClick={(event) =&gt; handleClick(event, navItem)}
+           className="block px-4 py-2 text-white hover:text-secondary transition-colors cursor-pointer uppercase"
+         &gt;
+           {navItem}
+         &lt;/a&gt;
+       ))}
+     &lt;/nav&gt;
+   )
+ }
+
```

Migrating HeroBanner with animations:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **write** • Edit file: /Users/sagarsawuck/.cursor/worktrees/sagarsys.net-1/USvKJ/components/HeroBanner.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 126, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,126 @@
- 
+ 'use client'
+ 
+ import { useEffect } from 'react'
+ import FullHeightSection from './FullHeightSection'
+ import useResizer from '@/hooks/useResizer'
+ import { cn } from '@/lib/utils'
+ 
+ export default function HeroBanner() {
+   const listItems = ['Passionate', 'Creative', 'Innovative', 'Dedicated']
+   const isMobile = useResizer()
+   const taglineFontSize = 24
+ 
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     // Generate fly animations for banner text
+     const style = document.createElement('style')
+     for (let i = 0; i &lt; 40; i++) {
+       const key = i + 1
+       const row = Math.floor(i / 20)
+       const col = i % 20
+       
+       // Generate random transforms for each character
+       const initX = Math.random() * 1000 - 500
+       const initY = Math.random() * 1000 - 500
+       const initZ = Math.random() * 1000 - 500
+       const initDepth = Math.random() * 3000 - 2500
+ 
+       style.textContent += &#96;
+         #banner .sagarsys:nth-child(${key}) {
+           clip-path: polygon(
+             ${col * 5}% ${row * 50}%,
+             ${(col + 1) * 5}% ${row * 50 + (key % 2) * 50}%,
+             ${(col + 0.5) * 5}% ${(row + 1) * 50}%
+           );
+           transform-origin: ${Math.random() * 100 - 50 + col * 5}% ${Math.random() * 100 - 50 + row * 50}%;
+           animation: fly${key} 5000ms ${i * 40}ms cubic-bezier(0.36, 0.1, 0.16, 1) infinite alternate;
+         }
+         @keyframes fly${key} {
+           0% {
+             opacity: 0;
+             transform: translate(-50%, -50%) rotateX(${initX}deg) rotateY(${initY}deg) rotateZ(${initZ}deg) translateZ(${initDepth}px);
+           }
+           10% {
+             opacity: 0;
+             transform: translate(-50%, -50%) rotateX(${initX}deg) rotateY(${initY}deg) rotateZ(${initZ}deg) translateZ(${initDepth}px);
+           }
+           90% {
+             opacity: 1;
+             transform: translate(-50%, -50%) rotate(0deg) rotateY(0deg) rotateZ(0deg) translateZ(0px);
+           }
+           100% {
+             opacity: 1;
+             transform: translate(-50%, -50%) rotate(0deg) rotateY(0deg) rotateZ(0deg) translateZ(0px);
+           }
+         }
+       &#96;
+     }
+     document.head.appendChild(style)
+     return () =&gt; {
+       document.head.removeChild(style)
+     }
+   }, [])
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;FullHeightSection id="home" height="60vh"&gt;
+       &lt;div className="flex flex-col h-full justify-center items-center px-6 text-center mt-[60px]"&gt;
+         &lt;div id="banner" className="relative w-full h-full"&gt;
```

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,37 @@
- 
+ import { Link as LinkIcon } from 'lucide-react'
+ import { cn } from '@/lib/utils'
+ 
+ interface LinkOrTextProps {
+   link?: string
+   title: string
+   color?: 'primary' | 'secondary' | 'textPrimary'
+ }
+ 
+ export function LinkOrText({ link, title, color = 'primary' }: LinkOrTextProps) {
+   const colorClasses = {
+     primary: 'text-primary',
+     secondary: 'text-secondary',
+     textPrimary: 'text-foreground',
+   }
+ 
+   if (link) {
+     return (
+       &lt;a
+         href={link}
+         target="_blank"
+         rel="noopener noreferrer"
+         className={cn(
+           'inline-flex items-center hover:underline',
+           colorClasses[color]
+         )}
+         title="Open website link in a new tab"
+       &gt;
+         {title}
+         &lt;LinkIcon className="ml-1 h-4 w-4 translate-y-[2px]" /&gt;
+       &lt;/a&gt;
+     )
+   }
+ 
+   return &lt;span className={colorClasses[color]}&gt;{title}&lt;/span&gt;
+ }
+ 
```

```diff
+ 'use client'
+ 
+ import Image from 'next/image'
+ import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'
+ import { Card, CardContent, CardFooter } from '@/components/ui/card'
+ 
+ interface MediaThumbCardProps {
+   title: string
+   link: string
+   thumb: string
+ }
+ 
+ export default function MediaThumbCard({
+   title,
+   link,
+   thumb,
+ }: MediaThumbCardProps) {
+   const handleClick = () =&gt; {
+     window.open(link, '_blank', 'noopener,noreferrer')
+   }
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;Card
+       className="max-w-[350px] mb-10 cursor-pointer hover:shadow-xl transition-shadow"
+       title="Click to open link"
+       onClick={handleClick}
+     &gt;
+       &lt;div className="relative w-full h-[200px]"&gt;
+         &lt;Image
+           src={&#96;/${thumb}&#96;}
+           alt={title}
+           fill
+           className="object-cover rounded-t-lg"
+         /&gt;
+       &lt;/div&gt;
+       &lt;CardContent className="pt-6"&gt;
+         &lt;h5 className="text-xl"&gt;{title}&lt;/h5&gt;
+       &lt;/CardContent&gt;
+       &lt;CardFooter className="p-4 pt-0"&gt;
+         &lt;Button
+           className="w-full"
+           size="sm"
+           variant="secondary"
+           onClick={(e) =&gt; {
+             e.stopPropagation()
+             handleClick()
+           }}
+         &gt;
+           Open link
+         &lt;/Button&gt;
+       &lt;/CardFooter&gt;
+     &lt;/Card&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
```

Migration complete. Summary:

## Migration complete

### What was done

1. Next.js 15 setup with TypeScript
   - Configured `next.config.js` with `output: 'export'` for static export to S3/CloudFront
   - Set up TypeScript configuration
   - Created app directory structure

2. Tailwind CSS & shadcn/ui
   - Installed and configured Tailwind CSS v3.4
   - Set up shadcn/ui with components: Button, Sheet, Dialog, Card, Tabs
   - Migrated Material UI theme colors (blueGrey[900], deepOrange[500])

3. Component migration (30+ components)
   - Converted all components from `.jsx` to `.tsx` with TypeScript
   - Replaced Material UI components with shadcn/ui + Tailwind CSS
   - Preserved functionality, styling, and animations

4. Hooks & helpers
   - Migrated all hooks and helpers to TypeScript
   - Updated for Next.js compatibility

5. Global styles
   - Converted SCSS to Tailwind CSS
   - Preserved custom fonts and animations
   - Maintained hero banner animations

6. Build & export
   - Build successful with static export
   - Ready for deployment to AWS S3/CloudFront

### Key features preserved
- Single-page application structure (root `/` route)
- Scroll-based navigation
- Responsive design (mobile/desktop)
- All animations and transitions
- Data fetching from JSON files
- Portfolio dialog functionality
- Career timeline
- Contact animations

### Next steps
1. Test locally: `npm run dev`
2. Build for production: `npm run build` (generates `out/` directory)
3. Deploy: Upload the `out/` directory to S3/CloudFront
4. Add new pages: Create `app/[route]/page.tsx` for additional routes

The project is ready for deployment and future development.

Upgrade complete. Summary:

## Upgrade complete: React v19 & Tailwind CSS v4

### Changes made

1. React v19
   - Updated `react` and `react-dom` to `^19.0.0`
   - Updated `@types/react` and `@types/react-dom` to `^19.0.0`
   - Installed React 19.2.1

2. Tailwind CSS v4
   - Installed `tailwindcss@^4.0.0` and `@tailwindcss/postcss@^4.0.0`
   - Removed `tailwind.config.ts` (v4 uses CSS-based configuration)
   - Updated `postcss.config.js` to use `@tailwindcss/postcss` plugin
   - Migrated configuration to `@theme` in `globals.css`
   - Changed from `@tailwind` directives to `@import "tailwindcss"`
   - Converted color values to use CSS custom properties in `@theme`

3. Configuration updates
   - PostCSS now uses `@tailwindcss/postcss` instead of `tailwindcss`
   - Theme configuration moved to CSS using `@theme` block
   - Font families, colors, and spacing defined as CSS variables
   - Fixed CSS import order warnings

### Build status
- Build successful
- Static export working
- No compilation errors
- All components compatible with React 19 and Tailwind v4

### Installed versions
- React: 19.2.1
- React DOM: 19.2.1
- Tailwind CSS: 4.1.17
- @tailwindcss/postcss: 4.1.17

The project is now using React v19 and Tailwind CSS v4. The build completes successfully and is ready for deployment.

Created a minimal `tailwind.config.ts` stub file to satisfy tools that expect it. Tailwind CSS v4 uses CSS-based configuration via `@theme` in `globals.css`, so this file is ignored by Tailwind but prevents the worktree error.

## Fixed

1. Created `tailwind.config.ts` — minimal stub file for tool compatibility
2. Updated `components.json` — restored the config reference
3. Verified build — still working correctly

The file contains:
```typescript
// Tailwind CSS v4 uses CSS-based configuration via @theme in globals.css
// This file exists for compatibility with tools that expect a config file
// Tailwind v4 will ignore this file and use the CSS configuration instead

export default {}
```

This should resolve the worktree error. Tailwind v4 will continue using the CSS-based configuration in `globals.css`, and tools that reference the config file will find it.

You can now proceed with your git operations without the "Unable to read file" error.
